page.title: 16LANDSCAPE IN SALISBURY
page.content: {Landscape and buildings Salisbury is a popular town because of the Cathedral with its 123m spire and beautiful medieval architecture. The centre is kept old by the council listing buildings. New buildings must be less than 12m so the Cathedral is not obscured. Some medieval buildings have shops built in them: one is the cinema. The town centre is cramped because of the narrow criss-cross streets laid down when Salisbury was first planned in 1220. Salisbury is in a valley where three rivers meet, and is surrounded by chalk hills. There are some open spaces by the rivers giving the impression that it is not overcrowded. Mallards, moorhens, swans and fish are found in the clear rivers.In the trees live animals such as grey squirrels. Salisbury is a lovely town.
